results.name: A(n,k) = n! * Laguerre(n,-k); square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..140, flattened
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Laguerre Polynomial
Index entries for sequences related to Laguerre polynomials
formula: A(n, k) = (2*n+k-1)*A(n-1, k) - (n-1)^2*A(n-2, k) for n > 1. - _Seiichi Manyama_, Feb 03 2021
mathematica: Table[A[n - k, k], {n, 0, 9}, {k, n, 0, -1}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, May 05 2019 *)
program: from sympy import binomial, factorial as f
def A(n, k): return f(n)*sum(binomial(n, i)*k**i/f(i) for i in range(n + 1))
for n in range(13): print([A(k, n - k) for k in range(n + 1)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Jun 28 2017
(PARI) {T(n, k) = if(n<2, k*n+1, (2*n+k-1)*T(n-1, k)-(n-1)^2*T(n-2, k))} \\ _Seiichi Manyama_, Feb 03 2021
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Jun 28 2017
